latestVersion.versionNote: Updated version of appendices and replication .do file to include statistical robustness checks inadvertently omitted from the original version.

fields.value: Replication data for: Logics of War: Explanations for Limited and Unlimited Conflicts

dsDescriptionValue.value: Documents here consist of the data used in the statistical analysis, a Stata .do file that replicates the results presented in the book, three statistical appendices discussing data generation and robustness checks, and a set of files that are necessary to generate the main datasets.

publicationCitation.value: Logics of War: Explanations for Limited and Unlimited Conflicts, Cornell University Press, 2013.

files.description: Stata .do file that replicates the regression tables and figures from the book and conducts additional robustness tests, including those reported in Appendix C.
files.label: analysis.do

dataFile.description: Stata .do file that replicates the regression tables and figures from the book and conducts additional robustness tests, including those reported in Appendix C.

files.description: Appendices.  Appendix A discusses the universe of cases, Appendix B discusses the coding of conquest and settlement variables, and Appendix C presents additional statistical robustness checks.
files.label: appendices.pdf

dataFile.description: Appendices.  Appendix A discusses the universe of cases, Appendix B discusses the coding of conquest and settlement variables, and Appendix C presents additional statistical robustness checks.

files.description: Stata .do file and associated data files to recreate the two main datasets -- running the do file will generate logics_of_war.dta and logics_warcost.dta.
files.label: data_setup.zip

dataFile.description: Stata .do file and associated data files to recreate the two main datasets -- running the do file will generate logics_of_war.dta and logics_warcost.dta.

files.description: Data file for replication of government spending results.
files.label: logics_warcost.tab

dataFile.description: Data file for replication of government spending results.
